title: [K-12] Case-Based Instructional Design Competency Enhancement Program for Pre-Service Mathematics Teachers: Integrating Equations, Graphs, Statistics, and Proof Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design theory, mathematics content knowledge (secondary curriculum-level formula/equation/graph interpretation, basic proof structure comprehension)
context.additional_context: Case-based discussions and project implementation in smartphone-centric, limited technological environments, utilizing basic functions such as calculator apps, graphing tools, and formula editors.

learning_goals: Analyze real classroom cases and categorize at least 3 instructional design strategies considering learner characteristics, environmental factors, and math content elements (equations, functions, statistics, proofs).

Based on 3+ design insights gathered through group discussions (4 members), learners will create a math lesson plan including 2 problem-solving activities (formula calculation/application), 1 graph interpretation task (function/statistics), and 1 proof activity, and deliver a 10-minute presentation meeting at least 4 out of 5 rubric criteria.

Achieve practical skills to iteratively improve an instructional design draft (visualizing calculation processes, formula application examples, graph analysis, proof explanations) at least twice through feedback incorporation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
